Operation 'homegraph.devices.query' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is clear about purpose and inputs but lacks explicit information about the response format. data.current_description: Gets the current states in Home Graph for the given set of the third-party user's devices. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see QueryRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Get current device states from Home Graph
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current states in Home Graph for the specified third-party user's devices. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id` in the request. Returns a QueryResponse containing the state of each requested device. This operation must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is clear about purpose and inputs but lacks explicit information about the response format. Added summary and clarified that the operation returns a QueryResponse with device states to improve AI agent understanding of what data will be returned.

message: Operation 'homegraph.devices.reportStateAndNotification' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but lacks explicit information about the response format. Added concise summary and clarified the response type to help AI agents understand what to expect after calling this operation.

data.current_description: Reports device state and optionally sends device notifications. Called by your smart home Action when the state of a third-party device changes or you need to send a notification about the device. See [Implement Report State](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/integration/report-state) for more information. This method updates the device state according to its declared [traits](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/primer/device-types-and-traits). Publishing a new state value outside of these traits will result in an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error response. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see ReportStateAndNotificationRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Report device state changes and send notifications
data.description_suggestion: Reports device state changes and optionally sends device notifications to Home Graph. Called when a third-party device's state changes or when a notification needs to be sent. The device state must conform to the device's declared traits; publishing state values outside these traits results in an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id`. Returns a ReportStateAndNotificationResponse confirming the update. This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but lacks explicit information about the response format. Added concise summary and clarified the response type to help AI agents understand what to expect after calling this operation.

message: Operation 'homegraph.devices.requestSync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description explains the purpose but doesn't clarify the response format or that this is an asynchronous trigger operation. Added summary and clarified that the response is empty on success, helping AI agents understand the expected behavior.

data.current_description: Requests Google to send an `action.devices.SYNC` [intent](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/intents/sync) to your smart home Action to update device metadata for the given user. The third-party user's identity is passed via the `agent_user_id` (see RequestSyncDevicesRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Request device metadata synchronization for user
data.description_suggestion: Requests Google to send a SYNC intent to your smart home Action to update device metadata for the specified third-party user. This triggers a device discovery/refresh operation. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id`. Returns a RequestSyncDevicesResponse (empty on success). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description explains the purpose but doesn't clarify the response format or that this is an asynchronous trigger operation. Added summary and clarified that the response is empty on success, helping AI agents understand the expected behavior.

data.current_description: Gets all the devices associated with the given third-party user. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see SyncRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Get all devices for third-party user
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all devices associated with the specified third-party user from Home Graph. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id` in the request. Returns a SyncResponse containing the complete list of devices with their metadata and capabilities. This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is clear about purpose and inputs but lacks explicit information about the response format. Added summary and clarified that the operation returns a SyncResponse with device metadata to improve AI agent understanding of available data.

message: Operation 'homegraph.agentUsers.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description explains the purpose and side effects but lacks explicit information about the response format and emphasizes the destructive nature. Added summary and clarified that the response is Empty on success, and emphasized the permanent nature of this operation for AI agent safety and understanding.

data.current_description: Unlinks the given third-party user from your smart home Action. All data related to this user will be deleted. For more details on how users link their accounts, see [fulfillment and authentication](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/primer/fulfillment). The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see DeleteAgentUserRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Unlink and delete third-party user account
data.description_suggestion: Unlinks the specified third-party user from your smart home Action and permanently deletes all associated data including devices, preferences, and state information. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id` path parameter. Returns an Empty response on successful deletion. This is a destructive operation that cannot be undone. This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description explains the purpose and side effects but lacks explicit information about the response format and emphasizes the destructive nature. Added summary and clarified that the response is Empty on success, and emphasized the permanent nature of this operation for AI agent safety and understanding.
